Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The event logs for Group A (Protected Group) and Group B (Unprotected Group) are compared for attributes like LocalResident, CommunityGroup, PreliminaryScore, ScoreAdjustment, and FinalDecision.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For each case in both groups, attributes including LocalResident and CommunityGroup, PreliminaryScore, and ScoreAdjustment are analyzed to identify differences in treatment and outcomes.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Patterns emerge showing that Group B cases receive a ScoreAdjustment if LocalResident is TRUE and CommunityGroup is 'Highland Civic Darts Club,' leading to differences in effective scores and final decisions.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: An assumption is made that the ScoreAdjustment applied to Group B gives an unfair advantage to cases where LocalResident is TRUE and CommunityGroup is specified, compared to Group A cases which have no ScoreAdjustment.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Comparison of cases with similar PreliminaryScores across groups (e.g., P001 vs U001) shows that a ScoreAdjustment in Group B may influence the FinalDecision even when PreliminaryScores are identical.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Propose that the bias in Group B manifests from the ScoreAdjustment mechanism being exclusively available to LocalResidents with specific CommunityGroup affiliations.

Name: Counterfactual Reasoning - IND
Text: If a ScoreAdjustment were applied to Group A cases or if no ScoreAdjustment were applied to Group B cases, it is hypothesized that the final decisions might have been more equitable.
